alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 10:36AM CDT until May 13 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo affecting Cass County. .The Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo has seen rise in the last 24 hours from recent rainfall, but is beginning to recede. The river is expected to fall below Minor flood stage later today into early Friday morning and continue falling through Action stage across the remainder of the forecast period. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD. Agricultural damage begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 18.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM CDT Thursday was 18.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 16.1 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
